post_text: Have you responded to the 2020 Census yet? Responding to the 2020 Census is simple, safe, and easy and provides billions of dollars in federal funding to your community. You can respond by visiting 2020census.gov, calling 844.330.2020, or by mailing in your census questionnaire.

post_text: Please help us congratulate our fellow Blue Ridge Physics and Engineering Club's NASA Rover Team for winning the STEM Engagement award for last years NASA Human Exploration Rover Challenge! https://loom.ly/lkU7ueI
shared_text:
NASA Human Exploration Rover Challenge
August 21 at 11:00 AM ·

Rover Challenge isn’t just a way for students to put their skills to use–it’s also an opportunity to share STEM with their local communities.

Congratulations to the winners of this year’s final award, the STEM Engagement Award–and to every team who took part in Rover Challenge this year!

post_text: Did you know the Arizona Education Tax Credit allows single taxpayers or a head of household a credit of up to $200, and married couples filing jointly, up to $400, if they contribute to eligible extracurricular activities to our schools by April 15 of each year? You'll receive a dollar-for dollar tax credit on your state income taxes. https://loom.ly/7GpCPSk

post_text:
Blue Ridge will assign a laptop to all BR students, grades k-12. Laptops will be distributed to students during the first week of August, beginning on August 3rd. Students lacking internet access will receive a hot spot to gain internet connectivity. ASU Prep Digital will be provided to grades 1-12. Our teachers will use ASU Prep as their base curriculum to guide instruction. ASU Prep is superior to other low cost options and a proven curriculum. Stay tuned today for more information regarding next steps. Go Jackets!

PLEASE FORWARD THIS MESSAGE TO FRIENDS AND FAMILY!
text:
Blue Ridge will assign a laptop to all BR students, grades k-12. Laptops will be distributed to students during the first week of August, beginning on August 3rd. Students lacking internet access will receive a hot spot to gain internet connectivity. ASU Prep Digital will be provided to grades 1-12. Our teachers will use ASU Prep as their base curriculum to guide instruction. ASU Prep is superior to other low cost options and a proven curriculum. Stay tuned today for more information regarding next steps. Go Jackets!

post_text:
*IMPORTANT INFO re: 2020-2021 School Registration*

Blue Ridge Schools will begin Online Registration Monday, May 4th, 2020, for ALL grade levels! Kindergarten Roundup will also begin Monday, May 4th with Online Registration. Be sure to tell your friends and family!

Don't forget - new registrations will need to have a birth certificate, proof of residence, and immunization paperwork ready to be uploaded - all online!

Just go to our website at www.BRUSD.org, and click on the Parents/Students/Registration link to begin. Directions are posted on the page, but if you have further questions, don't hesitate to call your student's school at the number listed on the registration page.

We look forward to seeing your student next year!

shared_text: Blue Ridge Unified School District #32
text:
BR buses have just left campus to deliver food on the AM bus routes to serve the kids!

Blue Ridge Unified School District #32

post_text:
*UPDATED*

Blue Ridge Unified School District Food Services Department
will be providing FREE meals to all children 18 years and younger. Monday-Friday 10AM - 12 Noon

*Option 1: Grab and Go Meals will be prepared and available on a drive thru basis at our primary location - Blue Ridge Elementary.

*Option 2: Distribution points are also available at McNary Elementary and Whiteriver at the Baptist Church on River Road.

*Option 3: Beginning 3/25/2020, Meals will be delivered using Elementary School bus stops as distribution points. Meals will be delivered 4 hours after your normal AM bus pick up time.

*UPDATED*

Blue Ridge Unified School District Food Services Department
will be providing FREE meals to all children 18 years and younger. Monday-Friday 10AM - 12 Noon

*Option 1: Grab and Go Meals will be prepared and available on a drive thru basis at our primary location - Blue Ridge Elementary.

*Option 2: Distribution points are also available at McNary Elementary and Whiteriver at the Baptist Church on River Road.

*Option 3: Beginning 3/25/2020, Meals will be delivered using Elementary School bus stops as distribution points. Meals will be delivered 4 hours after your normal AM bus pick up time.

Blue Ridge Unified School District Grab and Go Meals...

Monday-Friday 10am-12pm

During the time of school closure, BRUSD Food Services Department will be providing FREE meals to ALL children 18 years and younger.

**As per USDA Guidance, children must be present in the vehicle to receive the meal**

Meals will be prepared and available as a drive-thru option at the Blue Ridge Elementary Campus beginning:
Monday, March 23rd @ 10:00am and run through noon each day until normal school schedule resumes.

We would like to congratulate all our music students in their incredible performances the last two weeks at large group Festival! Congratulations to Mr. Brian Blomstrand, Miss Jennifer Olney, and Dr. Theresa Dick on their hard work with the kids! It's really awesome to see our program grow, flourish, and reflect the quality education that our music teachers give! Bravo everyone! Outstanding job!
Superior rating:
Harmonies, Sprezzas, Chamber Orchestra, Mixed Choir, Jr High Orchestra & Jr High Choir
Excellent rating:
Elementary intermediate Orchestra, High School Wind Ensemble

post_text:
Congrats! Blue Ridge JH 4-H Physics and Engineering club has made it to the top 20, and are 2019-2020 Samsung Solve for Tomorrow National Finalist!

The project video is published on social media for voting. The video with the most votes wins an additional $10,000.00 in technology for the classroom. We need your vote. Please follow this link: https://www.samsung.com/us/solvefortomorrow/ to vote for Blue Ridge Junior High 4-H Physics and Engineering Club (third video on the top). Also, please share your vote on Facebook and Twitter when prompted. Additionally, please forward this email to anyone and everyone. We appreciate your continued support!

post_text:
Thank you for the important part each of you has played in honoring our fallen hero, Officer David Kellywood. Despite the cold this morning, it was heartwarming to see hundreds of students, staff, and community members lining White Mtn. Boulevard to pay our last respects to Officer Kellywood, his family, and all First Responders.

Services for Officer Kellywood will be broadcast to the Blue Ridge High School Auditorium this Saturday, beginning at 11:00 AM. All that wish to participate are invited.
text:
Thank you for the important part each of you has played in honoring our fallen hero, Officer David Kellywood. Despite the cold this morning, it was heartwarming to see hundreds of students, staff, and community members lining White Mtn. Boulevard to pay our last respects to Officer Kellywood, his family, and all First Responders.

Services for Officer Kellywood will be broadcast to the Blue Ridge High School Auditorium this Saturday, beginning at 11:00 AM. All that wish to participate are invited.

post_text:
We are proud of our Boys Basketball team, coaches, parents, and fans for an exciting season! Your representation of Blue Ridge and our Core Values does not go unnoticed - WE ARE BR!

The following letter was received today from Mr. Benjamin Clark of Paradise Honors High School:

"Good morning everyone!

Saturday's game here at Paradise Honors was awesome! We had a sell out crowd here for the first time ever!

I wanted to let you know how much we appreciated your team coming to Surprise and playing in such an exciting game. I also wanted to tell you your athletes, coaches and parents were AMAZING. Many of them came up to our staff after the game and shook our hands to tell us how much they appreciated us hosting. After such an emotional and competitive night it can be hard to be so thoughtful and appreciative.

Thank you so much!

Ben Clark
District Athletic Director
Transportation Director
Paradise Honors High School"
text:
We are proud of our Boys Basketball team, coaches, parents, and fans for an exciting season! Your representation of Blue Ridge and our Core Values does not go unnoticed - WE ARE BR!

The following letter was received today from Mr. Benjamin Clark of Paradise Honors High School:

"Good morning everyone!

Saturday's game here at Paradise Honors was awesome! We had a sell out crowd here for the first time ever!

I wanted to let you know how much we appreciated your team coming to Surprise and playing in such an exciting game. I also wanted to tell you your athletes, coaches and parents were AMAZING. Many of them came up to our staff after the game and shook our hands to tell us how much they appreciated us hosting. After such an emotional and competitive night it can be hard to be so thoughtful and appreciative.

Thank you so much!

Ben Clark
District Athletic Director
Transportation Director
Paradise Honors High School"

post_text:
Dear BR Family:

A BBQ will be held tomorrow, February 19, from 4:00-6:00 PM at Blue Ridge High School Paul Moro Stadium, with all proceeds going to the Family of Officer David Kellywood. There is a minimum donation of $5 per plate. Please join us in a collective effort to share our love and support for the Kellywood family. Thank you for your consideration.

Respectfully,

Mike Wright
Superintendent of Schools
Blue Ridge Unified School District

Dear BR Family:

A BBQ will be held tomorrow, February 19, from 4:00-6:00 PM at Blue Ridge High School Paul Moro Stadium, with all proceeds going to the Family of Officer David Kellywood. There is a minimum donation of $5 per plate. Please join us in a collective effort to share our love and support for the Kellywood family. Thank you for your consideration.

Respectfully,

Blue Ridge Unified School District

post_text: 2012 Blue Ridge High School graduate, Officer David Kellywood of the White Mountain Apache Police Department, was killed in the line of duty at Hondah today, Monday, February 17, 2020. David was a great role model for our local kids. He was a student athlete, playing basketball for Blue Ridge, and a great family man who leaves behind his loving wife and two sons. We thank Officer Kellywood for being a great role model to our youth, and for his service and commitment to our community - he will be missed.
text: 2012 Blue Ridge High School graduate, Officer David Kellywood of the White Mountain Apache Police Department, was killed in the line of duty at Hondah today, Monday, February 17, 2020. David was a great role model for our local kids. He was a student athlete, playing basketball for Blue Ridge, and a great family man who leaves behind his loving wife and two sons. We thank Officer Kellywood for being a great role model to our youth, and for his service and commitment to our community - he will be missed.

post_text:
SAMSUNG CHALLENGE

The BR STEM TEAM was recognized in this week’s Independent for being one of the 100 National Finalist. The kids are working on their video with the help of Chris Paxman to submit their project which is due on February 21, 2020. Let’s keep our fingers crossed that the team earns a spot in the top 20 and travels to NYC for the finals. All top 20 teams receive a reward of $50K!

Go Jackets!

post_text:
BOYS BASKETBALL TEAM DEFEATS WINSLOW

Last night the boys' basketball team defeated the #4 team in the state in double overtime! It’s a whole new ball game. It was great to see the community and kids engaged in cheering on our Boys and Girls team. Come watch the Jackets on January 31st. The Girls’ Team plays at 6 PM, followed by the Boys’ at 7:30.

Go Jackets!

GOOD NEWS TO SHARE

Denise Green of Blue Ridge Elementary School was honored at the state level as the 6-8th grade Teacher of the Year by the VFW. She has been with Blue Ridge for 36 years.

Adam Reek was recognized as the VFW high school Teacher of the Year at the local level.

post_text:
Vision

Blue Ridge is the heart of our community; a family of diverse members committed to ensuring a purposeful, creative learning environment within a caring, collaborative culture for all. We are rich in tradition, achievement, and innovation.
We are BR!
